name: Mount Katahdin

trails_config.name: Hunt Trail (Appalachian Trail)
trails_config.description: The official finish of the AT. A grueling climb featuring the 'Gateway' boulders and the Tableland.
trails_config.parking_info: Katahdin Stream Campground, Baxter State Park, ME

trails_config.name: Helon Taylor & Knife Edge Loop
trails_config.description: Ascends to Pamola Peak and traverses the infamous Knife Edge ridge to Baxter Peak. Not for those with fear of heights.
trails_config.parking_info: Roaring Brook Campground, Baxter State Park, ME

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of Maine on Mount Katahdin. At 5269 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 5269 feet, Mount Katahdin is a standout peak in Maine. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Hunt Trail (Appalachian Trail)**, a **10.4 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **Maine 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
